InputHandler - Interface in it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Controller.InputHandler
The InputHandler interface defines the contract for classes that handle input messages.
They act as middleware between the ClientHandler and the Controllers, they parse serverUser inputs and either further the handling of the input to inputHandlers in the lower levels or if they are the target level they will execute the requested lobbyController method.
Classes implementing this interface are responsible for processing incoming messages from clients.
InputHandlerException - Exception Class in it.polimi.ingsw.Exceptions.Server.InputHandlerExceptions
Base exception class for InputHandler-related exceptions

Checks if the provided name is valid based on the following criteria: The name is not null. The name does not contain any spaces. The name only contains alphanumeric characters and underscores. The name has a length between 4 and 14 characters, inclusive.

For CardResource and CardStarter this method returns always true, because these cards don't have constraints to play the card, while for CardGolden checks if the constraints are satisfied or not.
